  12. To be quite honest I've always been a bit of a Tomboy in nature, you know, legos, Brio trains, and mud for me as a little girl. As I got older I was introduced to the wonders of the bra and shorn legs...yay. I digress, I recently have become smitten with makeup. It's relaxing and a great method for de-stressing or just getting out of your own mind for a moment. Everyone has a routine they follow and favorite eyeshadows, lipsticks, and mascaras they use.<br /><br />This set of brushes has found itself completely integrated into my daily routine. I use all of them, except the big fan brush which I have yet to discern an everyday purpose for. Hey, full disclosure right? Anyways, when I opened the box and saw the candy apple red sheath which, when unrolled, gave me a glimpse into heaven. I'm not being dramatic, I love this set of brushes. I'm not really sure what I was using before I bought these. Twigs? Leaves? Whatever it was it had no chance when put up against this set of brushes.<br /><br />I will most definitely be perusing amazon and the Shany cosmentics webpage for more steals and deals.<br /><br />Good buy!
  13. They are the best I had in a long, long time. They are really smooth and easy to clean. Like them a lot.
  14. The brushes are sturdy and a value for the price however the foundation brush tends to shed a bit during use.
  15. Great set of brushes for the price. Case is soft and flexible, easy to travel with. Would buy again for myself or gift.
  16. I bought these a few weeks ago, mainly because of the price. I didn't expect much, but for the number of brushes and the price, I figured I would try them. Turns out, they're GREAT brushes! The set has nice long handles, so they're easy to hold and use. I washed them first, and no bristles came out during the next uses. The brushes themselves are soft yet stiff, and they don't require you to mash into your make up to get the right amount to apply. For people learning to do their makeup or are overwhelmed with the number of brushes, the set comes with an instruction sheet and all the brushes are numbered, so it's an easy reference guide!
  17. very nice. the product is very nice to touch . the strands of hair are nice and it is worth the money

  135. Shipping was quick but was to be expected of Prime (we pay $80 a year for it, so it better be!)The product itself came in a pink pouch (nothing to be done about that) and it did smell chemical but a good wash took care of that, and it looks well made. The brushes are of acceptable quality, and they are soft to the skin, and the handles are long and have a comfortable hold. I did wash the brushes that very same day as it is recommended. There was a lot of dye and dirt coming off them (no surprise) and hair did also fall out, but they kept their shape well enough once dry. I did have to throw away the fan brush since it was impossible to shape and the bristles kept bending all over the place (who uses fan brushes anyway?), and most importantly (to me, at least) there is NO BLENDING BRUSH. I do like the brushes' sizes, since I have small eyes, I need small brushes, but I think it is imperative that a good brush set include at least one blending brush, if it is to be considered a \\"professional set.\\" Overall, it was a fair price for a fair brush set, but it would improve galaxies if the Shany people included a good blending brush in their sets.

Ok, on to the brushes: The brushes are not high quality at all, nor that soft. For instance -- there is no good eye blending brush, all the eye brushes are very stiff, good for lining or loading on color, but no blending eye brush. The \\"Face Brush\\" isn't plush or very large in diameter at all. If you are a casual user just wanting a set of brushes these are fine, however, if you are looking for good quality and versatility, these are not the brushes. Disappointing purchase all around. the one good thing I can say is the bag is good for traveling -- once I put other brushes in it!

  208. First let me start by saying I love how fast I got these brushes! I ordered then August 26 and they were here on August 27. I used Amazon prime 2day free shipping. My case I received was a metallic green, the case itself obviously will not stay together forever and why should it, its made of cheap vinyl but anyway for 25 dollars you can't complain. The case has embossing on the lower right corner of the opening flap. It reads \\"Profound\\" my guess is that is the makers trademark. Opening the case you will notice it is held shut by two large silver magnetic snaps. The snaps are just punctured into the vinyl so once they come out they are gone for good. Each brush is held in place netting. The brushes that are sown in the first picture are not ALL the ones you will receive. The brushes you should receive will be as follows: Two blush brushes, One large, one medium. A fan brush, A mascara brush, you should have one foundation brush (this will be the largest of the flat paint brush looking ones)you will have two concealer brushes that look almost identical, they are not, one is slightly longer and the brush is a bit wider then the other. you will have an angled brush that is best used for lining the top of the lids, a small lip brush, a brow comb/brush and an applicator. Each brush will come in plastic wrap to protect the brush. Four of the brushes will have a strong plastic \\"topper\\" keep the plastic that comes with the lip brush, fan brush and two blush brushes to help these keep their shape ladies. The bristles on these brushes appear to be glued in fairly well, again for 25 dollars you shouldn't complain you are not getting M.A.C. brushes nor are you getting Dior. So if you are going to complain then just do yourself a favor and don't buy the brushes. I will add my pictures of the case and each brush as soon as I find the connector to my digital camera. Then you can see what I think are more accurate photos of each brush..

If this smell was giving me a headache, I can't possibly use these brushes on face. I don't know if Shaney has any control over how their products are manufactured but if I had known it was made in china, i wouldn't have purchased it.   364. I ordered this product to replace my older makeup brushes, and it was long overdue. The product comes in a beautiful red leather carrying case with individual slots for each brush, great for traveling. My brushes also tend to get a little dirty, so the case will definitely help prevent that. I used super-saver shipping on this item, and I kind of regret it. I have bought several other items that, when shipped with only other Shany items, made their way to my home without delay. Because I chose super-saver shipping that included products from other companies, it took me twice as long to receive this item. This is definitely not Shany's fault, I would just recommend shipping the item seperately from other items in your cart if you are in a hurry to get it. Shany has been an awesome product for me thus far, i intend to purchase more from their company in the future. I would definitely recommend this product to a friend.

I have really enjoyed playing with all the different brushes and finding out which ones do this or that. I would definately suggest this item to anyone if they were looking for a new brush set. I forgot to mention that the mineral powder brush is really quite soft and doesnt feel like sandpaper to your face like kabuki brushes I've used before. I used to be a Mary Kay Senior Consultant and used their mineral power \\"kabuki\\" brush for what seems like years. I now realize that The Shany brush Set has really great quality and spreads the powder effotlessly and evenly.I've only had these a couple of weeks but they seem to be holding up well. Its not even a joke, it smells just like paint. I had to wash all my brushes before I used them. When you wash them you have to straighten the hairs out so they don't get frizzy and you can let them air dry and if the next day they are still wet use a blow dryer and it should be fine. Just remember to straighten the hairs out with your fingers, you don't want a frizz ball. But after that it doesn't smell as bad or it doesn't smell at all. It just needs a couple of washes. Also, I would recommend putting a bit of perfume in the pouch and the box if you are going to use them. Because if you don't it will just smell like paint.<br />Other then those little bugs, the brushes work great. I love using them, they are smooth on my skin.

  460. No blending brush which I knew beforehand but it's a bummer.<br />They smell at first so wash them! I used baby shampoo.<br />Four of the brushes come with protective covers (I wish and thought all did) but that's really nice for cleaning them because they are supposed to be dried upside down.<br /><br />How I clean:<br />I know there's a lot of fancy brush cleaning products but I've done it two different home remedy ways.<br />first way:<br />Get a small plate and poor some Johnsons Baby shampoo into it then get your brush wet and swirl it around. If the brushes are new, it's harder to tell when they're clean because no makeup will be coming out, so just use your best judgement; if they are old but just need to be cleaned, swirl them in the shampoo until the makeup stops making the soap brown (blue green ext.). Then paint circles on your hand as you rinse wish warm water so make sure each hair gets the shampoo off.<br />Second way:<br />I do the same as the first but instead of using Baby shampoo I use a mixture of dish soap and virgin olive oil, the dish soap is harsh on the brushes so use the oil to condition them.<br />To dry:<br />You never want to dry your brushes hair up. Because any water residue will drip down into the brush and loosen the glue holding the hairs. So that is when brush covers come in handy there is a product called the Brush Guard that you can buy separately that will protect your brushes. I just tape them upside down to my mirror and let them dry that way!<br /><br />Hope my novel helps at least one person! :P

  495. This is one of those classic cases of, \\"You can't judge a book by its cover.\\" I have good things, as well as bad things to say about this purchase, but overall, I am pleased and happy with what I purchased at the price of which I paid.<br /><br />PROS: Obviously I am going to start out with the good things about this product!<br />- Sleek appearance. These brushes have a professional look with the sleek handles.<br />- Wide variety of eye brushes. This set is primarily a brush set focused on the eyes. You are given three brushes designed for your overall face.<br />- SOFT BRISTLES. This one was HUGE for me. I recently spent much more on a set of \\"professional\\" brushes and was very disappointed at how stiff the bristles were. I actually ended up RETURNING them, and I rarely return make up products.<br />- Easy to store. With the carrying pouch allowing you to roll up the brushes, it makes it super easy to keep them organized.<br />- Shipped with extra protection. When I opened this product, I found that the pouch was tightly rolled up, tied, and placed in a cellophane wrapper. When I unrolled the pouch, I found that each brush was wrapped in cellophane separately, and the face brushes actually come with hard plastic protectors to keep on at all times. I really thought this was great, since the larger brushes can so easily become mis-shaped.<br /><br />CONS: Cause every review has to have em right?<br />- SMELL. The smell when you take this out of it's box will literally almost knock you over. It is terrible! This is where my comment, \\"You can't judge a book by its cover,\\" or by its smell in this case. Seriously, prepare yourself!<br />- The pouch itself. The pouch was a huge let down in my opinion. However, I did not buy this product for the case. So if you are buying this because you really want a carrying case, don't buy this product. The seems were sewn together VERY sloppy, and some of the sections that divide the brushes appeared to not have been sewn shut at all! Very disappointing in this aspect.<br />- There is an extremely weird powder on these brushes when you open them. If you read the product description very closely, it says to be SURE to wash these brushes before your first use. THIS IS EXTREMELY IMPORTANT!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If you don't read anything else in this review, which you really should because I KNOW my make up products, make SURE you read this. When I took the brushes out of the cellophane wrappers and ran my fingers through the bristles, this weird, gross smelling powder went flying into the air. Now, I am giving this company the benefit of the doubt by assuming this powder was something that settled in these bristles upon shipment.<br /><br />OVERALL, I really do like this product and for the price, I am very happy I bought it. BUT you NEED to make sure you wash these before you use them. Trust me, you do NOT want that smelly, gross stuff on your face. DO NOT WASH THESE BRUSHES WITH YOUR SHAMPOO OR DISH SOAP! These products are WAY too harsh, and they will strip your bristles. However, I am in no way saying you need to go spend $15.00 on \\"special brush soap.\\" I use and have always used baby shampoo on my brushes, even my expensive ones. It works great and easily washes out. Also, make sure you re-shape your brushes once you have them washed and that you let them COMPLETELY dry before you try and use them.
  496. These make-up brushes were brought to my attention on Pinterest and I ordered them immediately even though I was a bit suspicious about the low price. I have purchesed brushes from high end retailers such as bare minerals and department store cosmetics counters and these brushes were every bit as good and came beautifully packaged in a roll-up case for easy travel. I am a fanatic about softness on my face and this set exceeed my every expectation. Soft brushes were soft and stiff brushes were stiff. The price was extremely fair and I will be purchasing additional sets for both my daughter and daughter-in-law for stocking stuffers, but they would also make great bridal shower or teacher gifts as well.

For the price its ok but I think that if you're going to spend money on make up brushes, spend them on some quality ones.   563. Clearly that's to be expected because they're cheap and they use synthetic fibers, but the quality wasn't up to par. Also, if this is important: It doesn't come with a foundation/concealer brush either. I felt like I had to spend extra time doing my makeup because the brushes didn't collect enough of the makeup. A pro to these are that I haven't experienced any breakage or shedding. To sum it up, they work, they aren't rough, but you can tell when you use it that the quality (of the hairs) isn't good.

  741. i love it i cant wait to order more shany cosmetics!!

  744. bristles everywhere!!!!
  745. Heidy said that the product was very good.
  746. This was a present to my niece and she loves them! She has been using them constantly and has said that they are soft, professional and they are not falling apart after she washes them. I would recommend this!
  747. The ladies I gave these too loved them
  748. I really wanted to love these brushes and out of the box I did. These are completely gorgeous brushes and by FAR the most beautiful $13 brushes you will ever see. Out of the box I was in love. They are a hot pink reddish color with a matching case. The handles are long and sleek and so smooth and silky to the touch. The case is beautiful, sleek, heavy duty, and there was NO stitching coming undone. They look very professional. Also, there was only a faint smell coming from these brushes and I have had more expensive brushes that smell much MUCH worse. It seems SHANY took peoples suggestions with the smell and the case as I had no issues with either. So looks get 5 stars here. This is primarily an eye brush kit. To my knowledge all these brushes are natural hair (appear to be pony, not including the eyebrow comb). It is rare to find natural hair brushes at this low of a price, this is NOT to say synthetic brushes are cheaper, synthetic brushes can be outstanding and far better than natural and in this case these are really low quality natural hairs. The hairs, especially of the larger brushes feel like straw against my face. They are really not soft and silky. These brushes very thin and not very dense, which is expected at this price but I mean the brushes really fall flat against your face. The fan brush is so so thin it is unusable. But this isn't the main problem. The main problem is shedding. The first time you wash brushes it is common for loose hairs to come out but after that shedding should stop. These brushes shed SO much during the first wash, both the large and small brushes and there was hair all over my counter and my hands. Also there was a strange black powder coming out of some of the brushes... I am also careful to not get water in the ferrule so this should not have happened. Also when washing my brushes the smaller sized powder/blush brush handle came right off. There is very little glue used to hold the handle on and to hold the hairs inplace which is a huge problem. I was able to easily krazy glue the handle back into place but still not a good first impression. I put these brushes in my brush tree (hanging upside down) and let them dry overnight and the glue set. My big mistake here was not using a brush guard, you MUST use a mesh BRUSH GUARD when on the two larger brushes in this set (made by coastal scents available here on amazon, buy the muti pack). I reshaped the brushes while they were wet in my hand but that wasn't enough and they dried deformed. I washed these brushes a second time before using (which I don't normally do) and they still shed (not as much thankfully) making me very weary to use on myself. Also I was using baby shampoo which I use on all my brushes as it is very gentle and nurturing to the hair, especially natural. Do not I repeat DO NOT use dish soap or vinegar or any chemical like that, they will strip the natural hair and make these brushes weaker and scratchier than they already are. Above all there are much much better brushes in this price range, real techniques makes an eye and face kit each about the price of these that absolutely tower over the quality of these. Eco tools also makes better brushes than these. Coastal scents also have a natural and synthetic 22 piece brush mix that is much better than these. All these brush kits are available shipped and sold by amazon. If you are looking for a kit very similar to this in terms of the brush layout and natural hairs here it is (plus it includes makeup sponges!): [[ASIN:B00LJDDKH2 Essencell® Cosmetic Brushes-12pc Makeup Brush Set -High Quality Natural and Synthetic Hair Makeup Brushes -Soft and Dense- The Essential Makeup and Brushes for Deliver a Flawless Finish of Makeup Application- Be Classy & Elegant with This Professional M...]] Around the time of purchasing these I also purchased SHANYs pro-signature kit for $40 and those are significantly better brushes in every way superior to these. So SHANYs products are reasonably priced and some are definitely good, unfortunately these are not:(.

  778. Ok, first off I was very hesitant to purchase these brushes simply because I don't know that much about types of brushes and how to use them. I do know that brushes are VERY important for the process of applying make-up. I must say that I am very happy with my purchase! ESPECIALLY, for the price. They came in a red cosmetic case that is cheap but very handy for all of the brushes. The one thing that you ABSOLUTELY must do is WASH the brushes with hand soap. I used lavender hand soap. This is so important because when you receive the brushes they do have an odor to them, and even though they are soft at first, after washing them with hand soap the difference is outrageous. Another thing, is right when I received them I immediately felt the powder and blush brush and some bristles fell out. Wasn't too excited about this. And when I washed them, bristles fell out in the sink as well. This didn't happen with the eye brushes, thank goodness since they are the ones I mainly use. Now, when I use them (AFTER WASHING) no hair shedding!! And the odor is gone as well! I can't say again how important it is to wash them because the difference is like night and day, you will know what i'm talking about. I would recommend this product to people who use eye makeup every day because of the SOFTNESS of the bristles!

They are wonderful! The best part is you get 13 pieces for what $15-17.00? I was just in sephora the other day and they had a 4 or 5 piece for like $80.00. That is insane! The only complaint I have is that I wish these were labled with the brush number. I watch a lot of turorials on youtube and all their brushes have the standard brush number. So, I usually just guess on which one to use from my pouch......Be sure to wash the brushes after every use espically if you are using black shadow. You can wipe them off with a baby wipe or use soap and water. And BE SURE to lay them flat on a paper towl to dry. Never stand them upright, as this will damage the hairs. I also purchased the BH Cosmetics 120 pallette. Love, Love, Love:) Hope this helps and potential buyers!!

I checked each brush to see if I could gently pull out the hairs, I could not. I then washed them & let them dry overnight. I have had them for a couple of weeks now & I like them. I have not had any shedding, they are very soft. They are an odd mixed lot, I will say that. I think the only brush I dont like is the eyeliner brush, its cheap & just isnt sturdy enough to apply liner, but I really like the other ones. I read all the reviews before my purchase & was hesitant about such an inexpensive set, but I thought I would check them out & I am very glad I did. I do have some expensive brushes & honestly I cannot tell the difference. I do not leave them in the case, I have a brush stand that I made. The case still has a slight odor to it, but it doesnt bother me & I will use it for travel. Overall, I dont think you will be disappointed, give them a try, save the big bucks for makeup.

  1013. I really like the brush set. I use the powder brush regularly and it works so much better than the Sephora one I had before. The hairs are fine so it spreads my foundation powder thinner without sacrificing coverage. My face feels less cakey and my makeup doesn't feel as heavy. Pretty sure I use less foundation too, but don't quote me on this. Also, I love how the brushes feel. I've used brushes that feel harsh on my face and it almost hurts to put shadow/liner on.<br /><br />The one issue I have with the bigger brushes is that the bristles fall off easily. I usually gently tug at the hairs before I use the brush to get rid of any loose ends. Nothing came off when I did this. When I started putting powder on my face, there were bristles loose all over the brush and a few on my face. It doesn't happen all the time, and even when it does, I still prefer this brush over the Sephora one I had.
  1014. These do have a bit of a smell, but its not something excessive. Just wash them, and it goes away. Great value for number of brushes - and they work fine. There are the basic variety, which will work for a beginner and a more seasoned makeup artist. A couple of the brushes seem to be almost the same, they look like domed or crease brushes, wish it was a smudger but it's always good to have extras. I would recommend washing them prior to use in a gentle shampoo, rinse and lay out on a towel to dry.
  1189. I was so disappointed by this brush set. I love my Shany Neutral Eye Palette and I thought the brushes would be a perfect companion, and I received this set as a gift when I requested Shany brushes. They appeared to work well at first, but I started to wonder if the eye palette just wasn't good quality. I checked reviews on the palette that gushed about the pigmentation and began to get confused as to why I wasn't getting the same results when I did my makeup. On a hunch, I grabbed one of my ultra-cheap synthetic brushes and used that instead. Wow--the palette was great! The issue was these brushes! I have to use a LOT of eyeshadow to get ANY pigment on my eyes whatsoever because the fibers soak up all of the color. On top of that, the brushes shed all over my face, even though I have barely cleaned them. The shedding is getting worse, instead of better, and I have stopped using most. The eyeshadow brushes have lost their shape, even though I take extremely good care of my products, and at least one face brush has come loose in the handle and knocks about when I use it.<br /><br />It's just so disappointing--I had such high hopes for this brush set, and it not only doesn't work well, the quality appears to be less than stellar. I feel bad saying it, since I absolutely love the palette, but the brushes aren't good at all. I have waited several months to post this review, hoping that my first impressions of the set being nice would eventually come true, but the set just keeps degrading, and I have to advise against getting this set of brushes.

I use more of the eyeshadow brushes then anything else and have got to say they are good, although I wish the bigger eyeshadow brushes had been fluffier to help with blending. You receive 2 bigger fluffier blush/bronzer brushes, 1 fan brush, 2 bigger eyeshadow brushes, 1 medium sized eyeshadow brush, 1 angled eyeshadow brush, 2 smaller more detailing eyeshadow brushes, an eyebrow comb, lip color brush, and a smudger type brush. I love the pouch (in red) because I also use it to store some other brushes that I use. I wash them every couple of weeks and the brushes have rarely lost any hair. Overall I think that this is a fabulous set all together for a fair price.

It is very practical to have a lot of different brushes, but I got sick of how scratchy they were. They literally hurt my skin when applying my make up because the ends of the bristles are so harsh that it feels like I'm poking myself. If you angle them better, they won't feel as scratchy, but it's not worth the effort when you are just trying to apply makeup and be done with it. I prefer Sigma or Real Techniques. Simga brushes are expensive, so the only one I really wanted was the F80 Flat Top Kabuki Brush. This brush is an absolute MUST for liquid foundation. It is so soft and the flat top really makes a difference in the appearance of your makeup AND it doesn't absorb product which is a huge bonus because then you're not wasting your money. I bought the Real Techniques set (Core Collection) to replace a few essential brushes from this Shany collection. Real Techniques is affordable and much much much higher quality than these brushes.

The powder brush from this collection is very scratchy, and it shed like crazy. I ultimately had to throw it away because of the quality. The same goes for the blush brush in this set. The only positive is that it doesn't shed as much as the powder brush did.<br /><br />What I like about the E.L.F brushes are that they are labeled. As I stated earlier since I'm knew to makeup this makes things much easier for me. The Shany brushes don't. Let me just tell you: you get what you pay for with these brushes. They are extremely cheaply made and smell like harsh chemicals- something you really don't want on your face, applying makeup. The smell started to fade after I washed them a couple times, but every time I wash them they shed like crazy. Definitely beginner's brushes, because of the quality. I'd recommend Coastal Scents brush sets, they're quite affordable and great quality.<br /><br />MINI REVIEWS:<br /><br /> 1. Small definer liner/lip brush- I've tried this for red lipstick, it was OK, but it sheds like CRAZY.<br /><br /> 2. Large powder/blush brush- OK, but definitely not \\"fluffy,\\" like you would like to apply powder or blush. It's more flat, and does shed a little.<br /><br /> 3. Small powder/blush brush- Again, only OK. The plus is that it doesn't really shed.<br /><br /> 4. Brow/Lash comb- LOVE THIS. I use it every day. Great for blending brows and getting rid of mascara clumps!!<br /><br /> 5. Concealer brush- Good, firm concealer brush.<br /><br /> 6. \\"Foundation\\" brush- TINY. Basically another concealer brush.<br /><br /> 7. Angled brush- NOT FIRM AT ALL. Too frayed and thick for eyeliner, maybe good for brow powder.<br /><br /> 8. Sponge applicator brush- Meh. It's okay, if you like those. Might as well just take the free ones that come with drugstore eyeshadows.<br /><br /> 9. Fan brush- TINY. Again, not big enough, like the foundation brush, to do anything. Maybe dust away eyeshadow fallout, but that's it..<br /><br />10. Standard eyeshadow brush- Standard. Nothing special.<br /><br />11. \\"Pencil\\" smudge brush- Not firm enough to be a pencil brush. Tiny.<br /><br />12. \\"Crease\\" blending brush- TINY. OK, but really only for people with smaller eyes.<br /><br />All in all- you get what you pay for. Not worth it in my opinion. The brushes are also all too small to be usable. The only brush that I use everyday and love is the brow/lash comb. Not worth $12.are also all too small to be usable. The only brush that I use everyday and love is the brow/lash comb. Not worth $12.

These Shany brushes are much nicer. My hopes were high, since the makeup collection I have from Shany is so fantastic, I hoped the brushes would be as well. With so many shapes and comfortable handles, these brushes will last for a very long time.<br /><br />If you can't decide between Shany makeup and/or brushes vs.another brand, go with Shany!   1336. THESE ARE NATURAL HAIR BRUSHES made from goat and badger fur. If you assume you are buying a cruelty free product because they tout that they are a member of PETA on their description, you are incorrect. It's not like they go out an clip the fur off a live animal to make these, they are made from fur scraped off of hides before they are tanned for leather. Sure, you can say that using 'spare parts' makes you cruelty free, but let's be serious.<br /><br />Quality is lacking as well. These are a nice set of brushes if you are first starting out on your make-up journey, but they wear quickly. I wash my brushes once a week with warm water and Sephora brush shampoo and one of the large eye shadow brushes fell apart within only a few washes. Also, there are 17 brushes pictured in the online image, but you only get 12 seemingly random brushes. I did not get an eyebrow brush, one of those foam brushes pictured, the thin brush, and the standard sized brush.<br /><br />If you take make-up even a little bit seriously or if you have high end make-up that you want to apply correctly, please go buy quality brushes. If you are on a budget, the gift sets from Sonia Kashuk at Target are perfect and all under $25.

  1536. Here's what my experience has been with the brushes:<br />They look professional- love the colors. The bristles in mine were actually black which I prefer- makes it easier to see what's on them since I use a lot of light or saturated colors. They're soft and the application is very smooth and well-covered compared to many other brushes. I love the variety of sizes. What I dislike is the smell- I soaked mine in a body mist and rinsed before I used them- very potent scent when you open them. Also the pouch..don't plan on using that in any sort of regularity. It's not well constructed and it doesn't look nearly as neat or clean as the brushes themselves. If you're using the brushes either personally or professionally, highly recommend getting a good make up remover- these brushes cover so well that you'll really want to clean up or your foundation will wind up on your pillows/clothes at night. What works best for me is a toner- [[ASIN:B00BHRC7R4 Witch Hazel Rose Petal Toner with Aloe Vera + FREE Retinol Cream]]. Smells wonderful and cleans/moisturizes while removing the make up. Works on eyes too if you're not dosing your pads in it.

  1556. Now, I am not a make-up artist or anything like that. I don't do anyone's make-up except mine and when I do it's never much more than everyday simple make-up (unless there is a special occassion such as a wedding or something). So for me, this is the nicest set of make-up brushes I have ever had. It comes in a really nice red, pleather case that rolls and ties. The brushes are nice and organized and it's easy to keep them that way with the pouch they came in. My husband went onto my Amazon wishlist, saw this on there and ordered it for me as a Christmas gift. It was a great gift to get because it would not be something I think I would order for myself. All in all, I am very happy with it.
  1557. I have a few luxury brand makeup brushes but wanted something inexpensive - but still good - for experimenting with more daring, bold colors. I wanted to keep my $$$ brushes for my HG products, which are all gentle, neutral colors. I just didn't want to risk ruining the &#34;investment&#34; brushes, and didn't want to deal with using a quick-change wash, either.<br /><br />I searched for a pretty long time. I found some pretty awful brushes that discouraged me. So I half-heatedly put this SHANY set on my wish list, not getting my hopes up too too high, though the reviews were certainly encouraging.<br /><br />Well, Santa came through, slipping the bright red case into my stocking, and SHANY has absolutely blown me away with these unexpectedly high-quality brushes!<br /><br />What a set! I haven't even begun to use them all. I use the large all-over shadow brush to blend powder shadow onto the rest of my eye after applying a cream shadow to just the lids, below the crease. The effect is perfect, and it's so easy. I didn't own such a large shadow brush like that before, and I love it.<br /><br />I use some of the other shadow brushes to practice with really bold, heavily pigmented, unusual shades of purple, blue, green, black, and so on. They work beautifully, making the challenge much more manageable. And more fun!<br /><br />The brushes are soft and really hold shadow well, picking it right up and not dropping a bit as I move it to my eye. Then they release powder with easy, even distribution and blend beautifully. I'm just so impressed.<br /><br />And they all come in a handy organizer case, too. I can't believe I didn't know about this brand before! I'm definitely going to check out what else SHANY has to offer.<br /><br />If you're considering investing in a really expensive, luxury-brand brush set, I highly recommend you try this one first. You may find that you don't need to invest in another full set, and only want certain brush upgrades. It could save you lots of money.<br /><br />I'm thinking of getting another set to keep at my in-laws house, where we visit often. I like to keep some basic toiletries in the guest bath, making trips so much easier. This is the right price for that purpose.<br /><br />I also plan to get these for my nieces. It's a great set for anyone just starting to experiment with makeup. Of any age!<br /><br /> I give it 5 stars because it does exactly what I wanted at a great value. I've had no problems, all pleasures!<br /><br />Thank you &#34;Santa&#34; for this amazing brush set! It fits my needs PERFECTLY and often performs just as well as my &#34;fancy&#34; brushes!

  1618. For most of my life, I did not have the money or was not willing to spend the money to invest in expensive makeup brushes. I used the sponge-tip applicators that came with eye shadow to apply it and owned a VERY cheap, small set of blush/eye/lip brushes that I used for many years.<br /><br />In the last few years, I got back into makeup as a hobby and decided to get some new brushes. I thought the price of this collection of SHANY Professional brushes was super reasonable for all you get. Not only do you get 12 brushes, but you get a pouch that can store/carry them in. The pouch has individual pockets for each brush and each brush comes with a protective sleeve. The smaller ones have a long flimsy cellophane-type sleeve but the bigger brushes have have a heavier plastic protector for the brush tip that could be used to reshape the brush after washing.<br /><br />The kit includes:<br />1. Detail shadow brush<br />2. Lip gloss brush<br />3. Angled eye liner brush<br />4. Small shadow brush<br />5. Extra-large shadow brush<br />6. Face powder brush<br />7. Fan brush<br />8. Blush brush<br />9 Large shadow brush<br />10. Smudging sponge (sponge-tip shadow applicator/blender)<br />11. Lash/Brow brush<br />12. Eye liner brush<br /><br />I was a bit surprised at the exclusion of a contour brush and a lip liner brush. Both the #3 and #12 liner brushes specify (in the description) that they are intended for eyes and nothing in the description addressed contouring.<br /><br />My favorite and most-used of this set are 4, 5, 9 an 10. I use the 5 or 9 to blend all my eye shadow together to soften down the darker crease color for daytime and blend the colors together. I use 10 as a shadow applicator not as a smudging tool. I stopped using 6 and 8 due to the hair dropping (see more on this below). I now use RealTechniques brushes (the Expert Face Brush and the Stippling Brush) for powder and blush and have yet to see either drop a single hair. There are some brushes, like 3, 11 and 12, that I have never used because I don't use liquid eye liner, already had a brow brush I liked better, etc.<br /><br />According to the pamphlet in the box, these brushes are made of goat and badger hair. They are quite soft. Most of the brush tips are medium to chestnut brown. The handles are a pretty Chinese lacquer-type red and the ferrules are glossy black. The brushes are not labelled with their name (i.e., \\"Blush brush\\") but are labelled with a number, so as long as you keep the enclosed pamphlet, you'll be able to keep straight which brush is for what use. Note that there are multiple sets of these SHANY brushes. This set has brown hair brushes and comes in a red pouch. There is another set that comes in a purple pouch and has, I believe, black hair brushes.<br /><br />Quality-wise, it is a mixed bag. I have yet to see the ferrule of one of these brushes come apart from the handle, which is something I saw happen with my older cheap brush set. On the other hand, while I have not noticed the eye brushes dropping hairs much, I have seen a LOT of dropped hairs from the larger (blush and powder) brushes. I was regularly finding hairs on my face. As noted above, I stopped using the blush and powder brushes of this set because of the frequency of dropped hairs and now use RealTechniques brushes for that.<br /><br />The pouch these brushes come in is red and the material used (some sort of plastic) feels very cheap. It is bulky enough (even without the brushes in it) that I can't imagine ever using it to travel with because I have no need to carry that many brushes with me, but some may find it very useful for travel/storage.<br /><br />I think this would be a fine starter kit (and a nice present) for a young lady just starting out wearing makeup or newly out on her own. It would also be a nice kit for someone of any age who did not have the money (or want to spend the money) on the more expensive brushes.<br /><br />Frankly, if I had known about RealTechniques brushes BEFORE ordering this SHANY Professional set, I probably would not have purchased this set. I find the RealTechniques brushes to be of higher quality (but still reasonably priced) and, unlike these SHANY brushes which are made of animal hair, RT brushes are cruelty free.<br /><br />4.0 stars for the bargain price given the size of the collection.<br />3.25 stars for the quality of the brushes (hair dropping, animal hair).<br />2.5 stars for the quality of the pouch.<br /><br />Average: 3 1/4 starsechniques brushes BEFORE ordering this SHANY Professional set, I probably would not have purchased this set. I find the RealTechniques brushes to be of higher quality (but still reasonably priced) and, unlike these SHANY brushes which are made of animal hair, RT brushes are cruelty free.<br /><br />4.0 stars for the bargain price given the size of the collection.<br />3.25 stars for the quality of the brushes (hair dropping, animal hair).<br />2.5 stars for the quality of the pouch.<br /><br />Average: 3 1/4 stars

  1620. The brushes work wonderfully, the hair brush hair started to fall out when I cleaned them, so be careful. Other than that good. loved the bag it came in.

  1679. Theses brushes look great and appear to be above-average quality. They are a cheery red color with contrasting black bristles. The bristles are effective in applying makeup evenly and clean easily with soap and water or brush cleanser. The case/pouch for storage is another story. It is made of thin, black plastic held together by very poor stitching. I have had products arrive in disposable packing of better quality. Instead of storing the brushes in the provided case, I filled a small glass container with black aquarium stones and pushed the handles of the brushes in the stone. Not only does this look awesome on my makeup table, my brushes stay clean and dry. No need for that plastic case! Without the case, I would rate the brushes five stars.
  1680. I purchased these brushes over a year ago and they are still in fantastic condition. They do the job very well. Will definitely continue to buy from this company.

  1683. I was so disappointed by this brush set. I love my Shany Neutral Eye Palette and I thought the brushes would be a perfect companion, and I received this set as a gift when I requested Shany brushes. They appeared to work well at first, but I started to wonder if the eye palette just wasn't good quality. I checked reviews on the palette that gushed about the pigmentation and began to get confused as to why I wasn't getting the same results when I did my makeup. On a hunch, I grabbed one of my ultra-cheap synthetic brushes and used that instead. Wow--the palette was great! The issue was these brushes! I have to use a LOT of eyeshadow to get ANY pigment on my eyes whatsoever because the fibers soak up all of the color. On top of that, the brushes shed all over my face, even though I have barely cleaned them. The shedding is getting worse, instead of better, and I have stopped using most. The eyeshadow brushes have lost their shape, even though I take extremely good care of my products, and at least one face brush has come loose in the handle and knocks about when I use it.<br /><br />It's just so disappointing--I had such high hopes for this brush set, and it not only doesn't work well, the quality appears to be less than stellar. I feel bad saying it, since I absolutely love the palette, but the brushes aren't good at all. I have waited several months to post this review, hoping that my first impressions of the set being nice would eventually come true, but the set just keeps degrading, and I have to advise against getting this set of brushes.
